__metadata.__hint_A1: This section doesn't have part in SAV file structure. Here you define custom data types and constants for later use
__metadata.__hint_A2: There are built-in types you can use for the data fields:
__metadata.__hint_A3: - int: signed int, any length, bits or bytes
__metadata.__hint_A4: - uint: usigned int, any length, bits or bytes
__metadata.__hint_A5: - coords: a pair of 1 byte uints
__metadata.__hint_A7: - bits: a sequence of bits, big endian, any length in bytes
__metadata.__hint_A8: - bit_bool: a 1 bit boolean - 1 for true, 0 for false
__metadata.__hint_terrain_5bit_type: ..W values are deprecated regular forests, same as ..F. See supplemental-info.md for details
__metadata.__hint_3122: 4 bits-sized SHORT nation type of fixed length 2
__metadata.__hint_4: general type for 3-level buildings like armory, blackmith etc
__metadata.__hint_5: general type for 2-level buildings like carpenters shop and printing press

HEADER.__hint: This is just a hint or a comment. It doesn't have effect on the SAV decoding

unused01.__hint: some of these appear used for tracking revolution status.

colony_report_options_to_disable.__hint: Note that 'true' means to disable the given option.

how_to_win.__hint: this it not tutorial hints... what is it?

unknown00.__hint: these unknowns appear to be tutorial hints; used on discoverer level.

active_unit.__hint: index of an active unit in UNITs section, or -1 if none.

dwelling_count.__hint: tribes count, saving to meta for later use

unit_count.__hint: units count, saving to meta for later use

colony_count.__hint: colonies count, saving to meta for later use

unknown43a.__hint: looks somehow related to tax rate, despite the dedicated tax_rate field that we already have.

manual_save_flag.__hint: 01 for manual saves, 00 for autosaves. In case of 00 the game immediately ends your turn after loading the SAV

rebel_sentiment_report.__hint: 0-100, displayed in continental congress report for all players.

backup_force.__hint: army of a power ready to help you in fight for independance

price_group_state.__hint_1: For those goods that are in a price group (rum/cigars/cloth/coats), these contain
price_group_state.__hint_2: part of the internal state used for computing their market prices, used for all nations.
price_group_state.__hint_3: See the relevant section in supplemental-info.md for more details.

unused1.__hint: the game updates these, but they appear otherwise unused.

rum.__hint: used as part of rum's internal price group state.

cigars.__hint: used as part of cigars' internal price group state.

cloth.__hint: used as part of cloth's internal price group state.

coats.__hint: used as part of coats' internal price group state.

unused2.__hint: the game updates these, but they appear otherwise unused.

event.__hint: bit flags for events shown in a 'wood box'

named_new_world.__hint: the country_name field has been populated; only used for human player.

founded_colonies.__hint: might be used to pick next colony name

COLONY.__hint: count taken from HEAD section, see above

duration.__hint: duration of colonist's work at their jobs

tiles.__hint: each value is an index of a colonist from 'population' field working on current tile

warehouse_level.__hint: normally can be 0, 1 (for wh) or 2 (for wh exp), but can be manually set to any value

depletion_counter.__hint: when this hits 50 the silver/minerals resources being worked in the colony will deplete.

hammers_purchased.__hint: Cumulative hammers purchased (rushed construction). Possibly unused or used by AI.

damaged.__hint: Applies to artillery.  check if applies to ships.

moves.__hint: 'moves' count already made. One 'move' is one move by road

origin_settlement.__hint: index of COLONY (for colonist) or DWELLING (for brave) where unit is from

ai_plan_mode.__hint: Foreign AI planning modes flag character (ASCII), only for foreign powers

cargo_hold.__hint: last number contains pioneer tool count.

turns_worked.__hint: for ships on the high seas this is a counter that determines when they advance to the next position, which seems to happen when the value is 1 for sailing from either east or west.

profession_or_treasure_amount.__hint: Can be 'expert farmer' for ships, it's ok. A amount of gold for Treasure units (100's, i.e. 0x32 = 50d = 5000 gold)

transport_chain.__hint01: Defines an ordering of units, seems to be recomputed when one or a stack of units enters a square containing other
transport_chain.__hint02: units. E.g. applies for units at the gate of a colony, or units on a ship, or multiple ships with units on a square.
transport_chain.__hint03: It is possible that this is supposed to define which units are on a ship so that when two ships are on the same
transport_chain.__hint04: square there is no ambiguity.  Though if that is the case, it apparently does not work correctly. This should be

next_founding_father.__hint: index of founding father currently in progress, or -1 if none.

rebel_sentiment.__hint: 0-100, rebel sentiment for nation. Computed each turn, but appears unused; instead rebel_sentiment_report in the header is used for all nations.

royal_money.__hint: King's budget for expeditionary force expansion. Increased, then when it reaches a threshold, a new unit is added.

struct.__hint00: these two appear to mirror each other, though they may be different given some modifiers such as the dutch selling or the AI trading.
struct.__hint01: One is probably for the economics display which needs to be unmodified while the other is internal.
Appears that this goes up when an attack is made on the dwelling, and goes down when the dwelling's brave makes an attack.
struct.__hint02: Also looks like it might gradually drift downward on its own (?). When a brave attacks a colony it appears to be reset to zero.
struct.__hint03: Maybe the name of this field should be changed to retaliation, since it seems to store the number of attacks that braves
struct.__hint05: will make from that dwelling, potentially not including attacks motivated by the friction above. Note that this does not
struct.__hint06: seem to apply to attacking the dwelling's free brave. This will go up whether the attack on the dwelling succeeds or not.
struct.__hint07: Not sure, but it may also decrease by 2 occasionally... maybe when the brave attacks a colony?

muskets.__hint: not including muskets equipped by braves

stock.__hint: stock of each good used for trading (gifting and stealing not included). can be negative.

nation_unit_count.__hint: Number of free units the player has. See supplemental-info.md for more information.

nation_colony_count.__hint: Number of colonies of each nation.

suppress.__hint: See supplemental info for more information.

visitor_nation.__hint: also used to suppress an LCR that was visited.

CONNECTIVITY.__hint01: See supplemental-info.md for description of the algorithm that populates these.

strategy.__hint: these are the numbers that appear on screen when selecting 'show strategy' from the cheat menu.

prime_resource_seed.__hint: seed for both prime resources and lost city rumors.

unknown39d.__hint: Seems to be constant throughout the game.  Could be the high byte of the prime_resource_seed, though if it is then it would have no visible effect since the seed's value only matters mod 32.

stop_1_colony_index.__hint: corresponds to colony index in COLONY list

stop_2_colony_index.__hint: corresponds to colony index in COLONY list

stop_3_colony_index.__hint: corresponds to colony index in COLONY list

stop_4_colony_index.__hint: corresponds to colony index in COLONY list
